cont.entity_a: Metal construction is strong but prone to rust if not dried properly. Not dishwasher-safe, hand wash recommended to prevent rust.
cont.entity_b: Silicone coating split after a short period, exposing metal underneath. Silicone outer shell and metal insert work well on non-stick surfaces. Silicone edge can crack, exposing metal after extended use.

cont.entity_a: Handle can bend under pressure; not ideal for heavy-duty use.
cont.entity_b: The handle is plastic and melts on contact with hot surfaces. Handle and silicone melt under prolonged high heat.

cont.entity_a: The spatula bends easily. Sturdy design with perfect flexibility.
cont.entity_b: The spatula is too flexible and unwieldy for everyday use.

cont.entity_a: The blade is only 6.5 inches wide, not suitable for intended 14.75-inch width needs. Suitable for large pancakes and omelets but slightly thicker than desired.
cont.entity_b: Larger size is beneficial for bigger pans but tricky for smaller tasks.

cont.entity_a: Beveled edge and wide blade are effective for flipping various foods. Sharp edge suitable for cutting and flipping tasks.
cont.entity_b: Great for flipping larger food items but not suitable for breaking up meat.

cont.entity_a: Durable and has a well-attached handle, resistant to rust despite frequent use.
cont.entity_b: Silicone coating split after a short period, exposing metal underneath.
Heat resistant up to 600F and dishwasher safe.
Sturdy and easy to clean but food tends to stick.
